column5: I stepped on the front panel door of my favorite tacklebox.. Plano 777 ..and snapped the hinges .. since it's  pouring rain and I'm watching fishing shows.. I figured that it was Rednuck Repair time.  I used a pencil has a hinge , with the help of my Dremel I carved it out to fit, and some blasting wire with a couple of zip-ties to attach it all together.  Works well and saved me 60$ on a new box.     Randy
DUDE!!!!!!!!!!!! excellent idea !! yur a fart smeller......i mean smart feller.
Hey... I just noticed...What can you see in the first pic?.. Reflection .. think backwards.  Randy
EH!  Who else can see it?

The OFC sign ,and if you lived closer I have the same box in my basement that I don't use a bit busted up but on the top of 1 of the trays but good otherwise if your ever down this way PM me and it's yours.

looks like it will be sturdy, but just for the heck of it send Plano an e-mail and tell them what happened. If they do the same for you as they did for me they might replace the front panel. .  Make sure to mention that you really liked that tackle box.
Yer kinda a handy guy aintcha? Good thinking there fella.  Make the trip to the other side of the lake next spring Randy and we will try it out.
